plugin.name: üïì Event Helpers
plugin.description: Commands to extend NotePlan's events handling, including calendar lists, time blocks, and date offset templating. See link for more details, and configuration.
plugin.author: jgclark

plugin.commands.name: time blocks to calendar
plugin.commands.description: promote time blocks to be full calendar events

plugin.commands.name: insert day's events as list
plugin.commands.description: insert list of this day's calendar events at cursor

plugin.commands.name: insert matching events
plugin.commands.description: inserts this day's calendar events matching certain patterns at cursor

plugin.commands.name: process date offsets
plugin.commands.description: finds date offset patterns and turns them into due dates, based on date at start of section

plugin.commands.name: shift dates
plugin.commands.description: takes dates in the selection and shifts them forwards or backwards by a given date interval

plugin.commands.name: listDaysEvents
plugin.commands.description: function to list events for the current open Calendar note (for use in Templating)

plugin.commands.name: listMatchingDaysEvents
plugin.commands.description: function to list events for the current open Calendar note that match string defined in the settings (for use in Templating)

plugin.settings.title: Settings for insert day's events as list
Events heading
plugin.settings.description: Optional heading to put before list of the day's events

plugin.settings.title: Events List display format
plugin.settings.description:
The format string to use to customise how events are displayed (when run as a /command, not through a Template). The available placeholders are 'CAL', 'TITLE', 'EVENTLINK', 'DATE', 'START', 'END', 'NOTES', 'ATTENDEES', 'NOTES', 'URL'.
(Default is '- (*|CAL, |**|START|*) *|TITLE|**|
EVENTLINK|**|
with ATTENDEES|**|
NOTES|*'.)

plugin.settings.title: Events List display format for all-day events
plugin.settings.description:
The format string to use to customise how all-day events are displayed (when run as a /command, not through a Template). The available placeholders are 'CAL', 'TITLE', 'EVENTLINK', 'DATE', 'NOTES', 'ATTENDEES', 'NOTES', 'URL'.
(Default is '- (*|CAL, |**|START|*) *|TITLE|**|
EVENTLINK|**|
with ATTENDEES|**|
NOTES|*'.)

plugin.settings.title: Calendars to include
plugin.settings.description: Comma-separated list of calendar names to filter by when showing list of events. If empty, no filtering will be done, and so all calendars will be included.

plugin.settings.title: Calendar name mappings
plugin.settings.description: Map a calendar name to a new string - e.g. 'Jonathan' -> 'J' with 'Jonathan;J'. Separating the two parts of a mapping with semicolons, and use commas between maps.

plugin.settings.title: Additional settings for insert matching events
Matching Events heading
plugin.settings.description: Optional heading to put before list of events matching list below

plugin.settings.title: Events match list
plugin.settings.description: Match events with string on left, and then the string on the right is the template for how to insert this event (see README for details)

plugin.settings.title: Name of Calendar to write to
plugin.settings.description: The calendar name to write events to. Must be a writable calendar. If empty, then the default system calendar will be used.

plugin.settings.title: Default event duration
plugin.settings.description: Event duration (in minutes) to use when making an event from a time block, if an end time is not given.

plugin.settings.title: Confirm Event Creation?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to ask user to confirm each event to be created

plugin.settings.title: Remove time blocks when processed?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to remove time block after making an event from it

plugin.settings.title: Add event ID?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to add an '‚è∞event:ID' string in place of the time block, when creating an event from it

plugin.settings.title: Processed tag name
plugin.settings.description: Tag to optionally add on a line after making its time block an event

plugin.settings.title: Locale
plugin.settings.description: Optional Locale to use for times in events. If not given, will default to what the OS reports, or failing that, 'en-US'.
